results.title: A Children's Fable
results.brief_description: Three children, inspired by a program they saw on television, dress up in costumes and set out in search for the Holy Grail. Begun as a game, their quest becomes a terrifying adventure from which emerges a parable of racial confrontation and moral rebirth.
results.description: Three children, inspired by a program they saw on television, dress up in costumes and set out in search for the Holy Grail. Begun as a game, their quest becomes a terrifying adventure from which emerges a parable of racial confrontation and moral rebirth.

results.title: Children on trial
results.creator_credit: Jack Lee, Basil Wright and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatic story (which shows incidentally some of the root causes of delinquency) showing the progress of a boy and, in less detail, a girl who are sent to an Approved School in Britain. The film gives an insight into the problems of the staff of these schools, and the difficulties which the children encounter at the school, in their efforts to make social adjustments; and finally, the life they face when their period at the school is finished.

results.title: Children on the fringe
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Shows innovatory language stimulation techniques employed in a rural preschool designed for culturally disadvantaged part-Aboriginal and white children. Rationale, teaching strategies, evaluation and outcome are discussed. The relevance of the experiment for Australian preschool education is considered.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre

results.title: Children of two worlds
results.creator_credit: Edwin Scragg and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A child’s limited language ability can be a permanent bar to development in formal subjects. Looks at the problems of migrant children whose first language is not English, and the role of teachers in helping such children gain a thorough understanding and command of the English language. Suitable for tertiary/teacher education.

results.title: Children of the Sun
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which tells of the fun, pleasures and growing-up of a happy child. Also portrays the story of the unhappy child and stresses the need of U.N.I.C.E.F.’s assistance in providing health and happiness.

results.title: Children of the mountains
results.creator_credit: Otto Ritter, Heinrich Fueter and Condor Films
results.brief_description: The children of the mountain-dwellers of Switzerland must learn to adapt themselves to the reality of their environment. They have their own task; the boys help their fathers, learning crafts for later life, the girls help their mothers inside the home, and trudging to the village on errands. Apart from school they enjoy skiing, playing a game like hockey, and riding on a sleigh.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Otto Ritter, Heinrich Fueter and Condor Films

results.title: The Children of the mist
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes some of the problems of adjustment that the Maori and Polynesian islanders have, as they try to integrate into the European society of New Zealand, but still retain their tribal identity.

results.title: The Children of the city
results.creator_credit: Budge Cooper, Paul Rotha and Paul Rotha Productions
results.brief_description: This film illustrates how the Scottish Courts, under a recent Act of Parliament, treat the problems of juvenile delinquency, through the work of probation officers, child guidance clinics, and approved schools.

results.title: Children of Switzerland
results.brief_description: This film is designed to enable pupils to make a direct comparison with their own way of life, in order to help them towards a better understanding of the influence of environment on a people’s way of life. The children of a typical Swiss mountain farming family are introduced at work and at play. Directly recorded conversations in the Swiss language are featured in the film.
